item.title: Python: Defining Commands
item.description: An aspect of python that I have really enjoyed using is the ease of defining new commands and using them to solve complex problems on a variety of objects such as FASTA sequences, strings, and numerics. In R, we largely relied on pipes or pre-built libarires of functions for data manipulations, which I felt made solving problems a bit more segmented, making each step a new function or path. An example of this is shown in a snapshot from an early R homework assignment:
